tool.name: PACU
tool.description: whole genome sequencing based phylogeny of Illumina and ONT R9/R10 data
tool.command:
PACU_galaxy
## Input files --ref-fasta '$input.ref_fasta' --ref-fasta-name '$input.ref_fasta.name'
#for $bam in $input.bam_ilmn: #if $bam: --bam-ilmn $bam '$bam.name' #end if #end for
#for $bam in $input.bam_ont: #if $bam: --bam-ont $bam '$bam.name' #end if #end for
## Phages #if str($input.mask_phages.mask_phages_selector) == 'yes': --ref-bed $input.mask_phages.bed_phages #end if
## Tree building method #if $params.tree_method == 'mega': --use-mega #end if
## Other parameters --min-global-depth $params.min_global_depth $params.skip_gubbins
## Output files --output-html '$html' --output '$html.files_path'
## Variant filters --min-snp-af $filtering.min_snp_af --min-snp-qual $filtering.min_snp_qual --min-snp-depth $filtering.min_snp_depth --min-snp-dist $filtering.min_snp_dist
## Other options --threads \${GALAXY_SLOTS}

param.label: BAM files (Illumina)
param.help: Make sure the reads are mapped to the reference selected above.

param.label: BAM files (ONT)
param.help: Make sure the reads are mapped to the reference selected above.

param.label: BED file with (pro-)phage regions in the reference genome

param.name: tree_method
param.label: Tree building method
param.help: MEGA is not part of the Conda installation and may be unavailable.

param.label: Skip Gubbins
param.help: Skips recombination detection using Gubbins, this option can be used to work with fragmented reference genomes.

param.label: Min. global depth
param.help: Minimum depth across all samples for a position to be included in the SNP analysis.

tool.help:
**Warning:** At least four input BAM files are required for bootstrapping (these can be a mix of Illumina / ONT datasets).
**Note:** You can use the *'PACU - mapping'* tool in Galaxy to map Illumina or ONT reads to the reference genome.
